instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.820-00293: What is 820-00293? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A   Only one power port out of 4 work and only if I plug it in upside down.
threads.message:
I know that no schematic exists for this model but I am using <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00293</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 

I am looking at the USB-C signals off of J3300 and there are top and bottom.  Both go to the same CD-3215 depending on the port used.  All 4 ports are dead but one works if I plug the charger in upside down.

Would it be safe to assume I need to replace all the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>'s on this LB?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A   Only one power port out of 4 work and only if I plug it in upside down.
threads.message:
Start with the port which works one direction only.
Check diode mode to ground for CC1/2 pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A   Only one power port out of 4 work and only if I plug it in upside down.
threads.message:
CC1 is basically a short
CC2 is 0.02

I have been poking around on these.   Lots are shorted.   Some are fine when I slide the surge diodes off others are not

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A   Only one power port out of 4 work and only if I plug it in upside down.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A   Only one power port out of 4 work and only if I plug it in upside down.
threads.message: I changed them.   Still had problems.  :(  replaced the LB
